516050.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516050
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 050
516050.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Abu'z-Zinad from al-Araj from Abu Hurayra that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Adam and Musa argued and Adam got the better of Musa. Musa rebuked Adam, 'You are Adam who led people astray and brought them out of the Garden.' Adam said to him, 'You are Musa to whom Allah gave knowledge of everything and whom he chose above people with His message.' He said, 'Yes.' He said, 'Do you then censure me for a matter which was decreed for me before I was created?' "

516060.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516060
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 060
516060.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Zayd ibn Abi Unaysa that Abd al-Hamid ibn Abd ar-Rahman ibn Zayd ibn al-Khattab informed him from Muslim ibn Yasar al-Juhani that Umar ibn al-Khattab was asked about this ayat - "When your Lord took their progeny from the Banu Adam from their backs and made them testify against themselves. 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yes, we bear witness'

516070.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516070
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 070
516070.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he heard that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I have left two matters with you. As long as you hold to them, you will not go the wrong way. They are the Book of Allah and the Sunna of His Prophet."

516080.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516080
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 080
516080.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Ziyad ibn Sad from Amr ibn Muslim that Tawus al-Yamani said, "I found some of the companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying 'Everything is by decree.' " Tawus added, "I heard Abdullah ibn Umar say that The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. said, 'Everything is by decree - even incapacity and ability,' (or 'ability and incapacity')."

516090.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516090
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 090
516090.text: Malik related to me from Ziyad ibn Sad that Amr ibn Dinar said, "I heard Abdullah ibn az-Zubayr say in a khutba, 'Allah - He is the Guider and the One Who Tempts Away.' "

516100.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516100
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 100
516100.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that his paternal uncle, Abu Suhayl ibn Malik said, "I was a prisoner with Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz. He said, 'What do you think about these Qadariyya (fatalists)?' I said, 'My opinion is that one should ask them to turn from wrong action, if they will do so. If not, subject them to the sword.' Umar ibn Abd al- Aziz said, 'That is my opinion.

516110.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516110
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 110
516110.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Abu'z-Zinad from al-Araj from Abu Hurayra that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "A woman should not ask for the divorce of her sister to make her plate empty and in order to marry. She has what is decreed for her."

516120.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516120
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 120
516120.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Yazid ibn Ziyad that Muhammad ibn Kab al-Quradhi said, ''Muawiya ibn Abi Sufyan said from the mimbar, 'O people! Nothing keeps away what Allah gives and nothing gives what Allah keeps away. The earnestness of the earnest one does not profit him. When Allah desires good for him, he gives him understanding in the deen.' Then Muawiya said, 'I heard these words from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on these blocks of wood.' "

516130.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516130
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 130
516130.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he had heard that this was said "Praise be to Allah who created everything as is necessary, who does not hasten anything He defers and determines. Allah is enough for me and sufficient. Allah hears whoever makes dua to him. Allah does not have a goal."

516140.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 516140
In-book reference  : Book 46, Hadith 140
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 46, Hadith 140
516140.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he heard that this was said "No one will die until his provision is completed for him, so behave correctly in your seeking it."
